Rule 1:
Thoughts: The rule states that a written treatment and cost plan must be set up after the diagnosis and possibly evaluation of models. This rule is quite abstract and does not provide specific conditions that can be translated into a Prolog rule. However, we can interpret this rule as a requirement for a consultation service (assuming that the consultation service includes diagnosis and possibly evaluation of models) to be present before any other service in the invoice. We can check if the first service in the list is a consultation service. If not, the invoice is invalid.

Translation:
```prolog
% Helper predicate to check if the first service is a consultation
is_first_service_consultation([service(_, _, _, _, _, Description, _, _) | _]) :-
    Description = 'Consultation'.

% Main predicate to check the validity of the invoice
is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    \+ is_first_service_consultation(Services),
    print('Invalid invoice: A consultation service must be the first service in the invoice.'),
    true.
```

Rule 1:
Thoughts: The rule states that the services with numbers 0030 and 0040 cannot be billed together. This means that if both of these services are present in the same invoice, the invoice is invalid. We can translate this rule by checking if both of these services are present in the same invoice.

Translation:
```prolog
% Helper predicate to check if a service with a specific number is in the list of services
service_in_list(ServiceNumber, [service(ServiceNumber, _, _, _, _, _, _, _)|_]).
service_in_list(ServiceNumber, [_|T]) :- service_in_list(ServiceNumber, T).

is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    service_in_list(0030, Services),
    service_in_list(0040, Services),
    print('Services 0030 and 0040 cannot be billed together.'),
    true.
```
In this translation, we first define a helper predicate `service_in_list/2` that checks if a service with a specific number is present in a list of services. This predicate uses recursion to traverse the list of services. If it finds a service with the specified number, it succeeds. If it doesn't find such a service, it fails.

llm_response:
Rule 1:
Thoughts: The rule states that if services 0050 and 0060 are billed together, a justification must be provided in the invoice. This can be translated into a Prolog rule by checking if both services are present in the invoice and if so, whether a justification is provided. 

Translation:
```prolog
% Helper predicate to check if a service is in the invoice
service_in_invoice(Service, [service(Service, _, _, _, _, _, _, _)|_]).
service_in_invoice(Service, [_|T]) :- service_in_invoice(Service, T).

% Helper predicate to check if a service in the invoice has a justification
service_has_justification(Service, [service(Service, _, _, _, _, _, Justification, _)|_]) :- Justification \= ''.
service_has_justification(Service, [_|T]) :- service_has_justification(Service, T).

is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    service_in_invoice(0050, Services),
    service_in_invoice(0060, Services),
    \+ service_has_justification(0050, Services),
    \+ service_has_justification(0060, Services),
    print('Services 0050 and 0060 are billed together but no justification is provided.'),
    true.
```
This rule checks if both services 0050 and 0060 are present in the invoice. If they are, it checks if a justification is provided for both services. If no justification is provided for either service, it prints a message indicating the reason for the invalidity of the invoice and returns true, marking the invoice as invalid.

che Registrierung der Bissverhältnisse auf digita- schen Abformung analog § 6 Absatz 1 GOZ
lem Weg ist nicht gesondert berechnungsfähig. – u. v. m.
Darüber hinausgehende Bissregistrierungen sind
nicht inbegriffen.
Die Leistung wird je Kieferhälfte oder Frontzahnbe-
reich berechnet und kann ggf. bis zu viermal je Sit-
zung anfallen. Bei unterschiedlicher Indikation kann
die Leistung auch mehrfach berechnet werden.
Vorbereitende Maßnahmen wie z. B. die optische
Aufbereitung der abzuformenden Zähne oder Mo-
delle sowie die Archivierung der Daten sind einge-
schlossen. Die Nebeneinanderberechnung dieser
Leistung und einer konventionellen Abformung in
derselben Sitzung für dasselbe Behandlungsgebiet
ist nicht statthaft. Die Geb.-Nr. 0065 darf neben
einer Leistung, die neben anderen Leistungsbe-
standteilen auch Abformungen beinhalten, zusätz-
lich berechnet werden.
Konventionelle Abformungen im Sinne der nach
gelagerten Abrechnungsbestimmungen sind aus-
<<
schließlich die Abformungen nach den Geb.-Nrn.
Inhalt 5170, 5180, 5190 GOZ. Die Nebeneinanderberech-
nung dieser Leistungen und der Geb.-Nr. 0065 für
denselben Kiefer ist nicht statthaft. Die PC-ge-
stützte Auswertung zur Diagnose und Planung ist
bei dieser Gebührennummer nicht enthalten und
muss daher analog berechnet werden.

llm_response:
Rule 1:
Thoughts: The rule states that if a service with the number 0065 (optisch-elektronische Abformung) is billed for a specific tooth area, no other conventional Abformungen can be billed for the same tooth area. This means we need to check if there is a service with the number 0065 for a specific tooth area and if there is, check if there are any other services for the same tooth area. If there are, the invoice is invalid.

Translation:
```prolog
% Helper predicate to check if a service with the number 0065 exists for a specific tooth area
service_0065_exists_for_area(Services, Area) :-
    member(service(0065, _, _, _, _, _, _, Teeth), Services),
    member(tooth(Area, _), Teeth).

% Helper predicate to check if there are any other services for a specific tooth area
other_services_exist_for_area(Services, Area) :-
    member(service(Service, _, _, _, _, _, _, Teeth), Services),
    Service \= 0065,
    member(tooth(Area, _), Teeth).

% Main predicate to check if the invoice is invalid
is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    member(Area, [1, 2, 3, 4]), % Check for each tooth area
    service_0065_exists_for_area(Services, Area),
    other_services_exist_for_area(Services, Area),
    print('Invoice is invalid: Service 0065 and other services exist for the same tooth area.'),
    true.
```
This code first checks if there is a service with the number 0065 for each tooth area. If there is, it checks if there are any other services for the same tooth area. If there are, it prints a message stating that the invoice is invalid and returns true.

Kommentar zur Leistungsbeschreibung
Die Überprüfung der Sensibilität eines Zahnes bzw.
der Vitalität der Pulpa kann mittels verschiedener
Methoden erfolgen. Die Prüfung kann an einem,
mehreren oder allen Zähnen durchgeführt werden.
Der Reaktionsvergleich mit anderen Zähnen in
derselben Sitzung ist abgegolten.
Auch bei der Anwendung unterschiedlicher Me-
thoden ist die Testung nur einmal berechenbar.
Die Vitalitätsprobe kann im Verlauf einer Behand-
lung an unterschiedlichen Behandlungstagen er-
neut erforderlich werden.

– Höhere Anzahl der überprüften Zähne
– Mehrfache (Vergleichs-)Testungen
– Anwendung verschiedener Testmethoden

bei traumatisiertem Zahn

– Probetrepanation

Intraorale Oberflächenanästhesie,
je Kieferhälfte oder Frontzahnbe -
reich
reference: The text provided does not contain any references to other paragraphs.
commentary:
A Allgemeine zahnärztliche Leistungen
GOZ Nr. 0080
Intraorale Oberflächenanästhesie, je Kieferhälfte Zusätzlich berechnungsfähige Leistungen
oder Frontzahnbereich – Weitere Anästhesieleistungen GOZ 0090/0100
– u. v. m.
Punktzahl 30 Punkte
Faktor 1,0-fach 2,3-fach 3,5-fach GOZ 1988
Gebühr in € 1,69 € 3,88 € 5,91 € GOZ Nr.: 008
Intraorale Oberflächenanästhesie, je Kieferhälfte
Kommentar zur Leistungsbeschreibung oder Frontzahnbereich
Das Aufbringen von Medikamenten in Form von
Punktzahl 30 Punkte
Spray, Lösungen, Gelen o. Ä. zur „Intraoralen
Oberflächenanästhesie“ ist als selbstständige Leis- Faktor 1,0-fach 2,3-fach 3,5-fach
tung (z. B. zum Ausschalten des Würgereflexes) Gebühr in € 1,69 € 3,88 € 5,90 €
oder als vorbereitende Maßnahme bei anderen
Anästhesien (Infiltrations- oder Leitungsanästhe-
sie) berechenbar.
Auch spezielle elektrische Verfahren mittels
Schwachstrom (TENS), thermische Verfahren (Kälte-
spray) oder mechanische Verfahren zur Durchfüh-
rung einer Anästhesie der Schleimhautoberfläche
können eingesetzt werden.
Die Gebühr ist je Kieferhälfte oder Frontzahnbe-
reich anzusetzen. Die Wiederholung einer Ober-
flächenanästhesie nach Wirkungsverlust löst
erneut den Ansatz der Nummer 0080 aus.
Nicht berechenbar ist die Leistung für eine extrao-
rale Oberflächenbetäubung.
Das verwendete Medikament kann nicht separat
berechnet werden.
Zusätzlicher Aufwand
– Oberflächenanästhesien an mehreren Stellen
innerhalb einer Kieferhälfte bzw. eines Frontzahn-
bereichs
– subgingivale Applikation
– u. v. m.
<<
Inhalt
44

Seite 2.3.2015

content: Intraorale Infiltrationsanästhesie
reference: The text provided does not contain any references to other paragraphs.
commentary:
GOZ Nr. 0090
Intraorale Infiltrationsanästhesie rialien (z. B. Kanüle) können nicht gesondert be-
Abrechnungsbestimmung rechnet werden.
Wird die Leistung nach der Nummer 0090 je Zahn Injektionen bzw. Anästhesien zu Heilzwecken kön-
mehr als einmal berechnet, ist dies in der Rech- nen nach Nummer 267 (GOÄ) berechnet werden.
nung zu begründen.
Bei den Leistungen nach den Nummern 0090 und Zusätzlicher Aufwand
0100 sind die Kosten der verwendeten Anästhe- – Verzögerter Wirkungseintritt
tika gesondert berechnungsfähig. – Injektion in hyperämischem Gebiet
– Kreislaufproblematik
Punktzahl 60 Punkte – u. v. m.
Faktor 1,0-fach 2,3-fach 3,5-fach
Zusätzlich berechnungsfähige Leistungen
Gebühr in € 3,37 € 7,76 € 11,81 €
– Weitere Anästhesieleistungen GOZ 0080
Kommentar zur Leistungsbeschreibung GOZ 0100
Die lokale Schmerzausschaltung (Infiltrationsanäs- – u. v. m.
thesie) wird je Zahn einmal berechnet. Sofern ein
Einstich zur vollständigen Schmerzausschaltung GOZ 1988
am behandelten Zahn nicht ausreichend ist, kann GOZ Nr.: 009
auch mehrfach bzw. an unterschiedlichen Stellen Intraorale Infiltrationsanästhesie
anästhesiert werden und ist dann auch mehrfach
Punktzahl 60 Punkte
berechnungsfähig. Bei der mehrfachen Anästhe-
sieberechnung pro Zahn ist dies in der Rechnung Faktor 1,0-fach 2,3-fach 3,5-fach
mit einem kurzen nachvollziehbaren Begrün- Gebühr in € 3,37 € 7,76 € 11,81 €
dungshinweis zu versehen. Auch bei lang dauern-
den Eingriffen mit Nachinjektion ist die Leistung
mehrfach pro Zahn berechnungsfähig.
Zur lokalen Schmerzausschaltung nach Nummer
0090 zählen auch die intraligamentäre, intrakana-
läre, intrapulpäre und intraossäre Anästhesie. Bei
einer Kombination, z. B. einer intraligamentären
mit der Infiltrationsanästhesie kann die Berech-
nung mit entsprechendem Begründungshinweis
auch mehrfach pro Zahn und Sitzung berechnet
werden. Infiltrationsanästhesien zur Ausschaltung
von Anastomosen können ohne Begründungshin-
weis zusätzlich berechnet werden, weil sie ein an-
deres (Zahn-)Gebiet als den behandelten Zahn
betreffen.
In zahnlosen Kieferabschnitten kann die Infiltrati-
onsanästhesie entsprechend dem zahnmedizini-
schen Erfordernis mehrfach berechnet werden.

Intraorale Leitungsanästhesie
Wird die Leistung nach der Num -
mer 0090 je Zahn mehr als einmal
berechnet, ist dies in der Rech -
nung zu begründen.
Bei den Leistungen nach den
Nummern 0090 und 0100 sind die
Kosten der verwendeten Anästhe -
tika gesondert berechnungsfähig.
reference: References: Nummer 0090, Nummer 0100
rule: Wird die Leistung nach der Nummer 0090 je Zahn mehr als einmal berechnet, ist dies in der Rechnung zu begründen.
commentary:
A Allgemeine zahnärztliche Leistungen
GOZ Nr. 0100
Intraorale Leitungsanästhesie Zusätzlich berechnungsfähige Leistungen
Abrechnungsbestimmung – Weitere Anästhesieleistungen GOZ 0080
Bei den Leistungen nach den Nummern 0090 und GOZ 0900
0100 sind die Kosten der verwendeten Anästhe-
tika gesondert berechnungsfähig. GOZ 1988
GOZ Nr.: 010
Punktzahl 70 Punkte Intraorale Leitungsanästhesie
Faktor 1,0-fach 2,3-fach 3,5-fach
Punktzahl 70 Punkte
Gebühr in € 3,94 € 9,05 € 13,78 €
Faktor 1,0-fach 2,3-fach 3,5-fach

Bei der Leitungsanästhesie wird das gesamte Ver-
sorgungsgebiet des jeweiligen Nervs betäubt. Im
Unterkiefer sind dies z. B. der Nervus mandibularis
oder der Nervus mentalis, im Oberkiefer z. B. die
Tuberanästhesie, der Nervus palatinus majus, der
Nervus infraorbitalis.
Die Leitungsanästhesie ist entsprechend der An-
zahl der zu anästhesierenden Nerven und/oder
bei lang dauernden Eingriffen auch mehrfach
berechnungsfähig. Eine Begründung für den
mehrfachen Ansatz der Leistung nach Nummer
0100 oder für die Nebeneinanderberechnung der
Nummern 0100 und 0090 ist empfehlenswert.
Eine Leitungsanästhesie kann auch am Nervus
mentalis erfolgen.
Die intraorale Leitungsanästhesie kann in dersel-
ben Sitzung auch mit einer Infiltrationsanästhesie
zusammen berechnet werden, z. B. zur Ausschal-
tung von Anastomosen der Gegenseite.
Das Anästhesiemittel ist gesondert berechnungs-
fähig. Die zur Injektion verwendeten Einmalmate-
rialien (z. B. Kanüle) können nicht gesondert
berechnet werden.
Injektionen bzw. Anästhesien zu Heilzwecken kön-
nen nach Nummer 267 (GOÄ) berechnet werden.
Die extraorale Leitungsanästhesie ist in der GOZ
nicht mehr enthalten. Sie kann analog berechnet
werden.

llm_response:
Rule 1:
Thoughts: This rule states that if the service with number 0090 is charged more than once per tooth, it must be justified in the invoice. This can be translated into Prolog by checking for each tooth if the service 0090 is applied more than once and if so, if there is a justification. 

Translation:
```prolog
% Helper predicate to count the number of times a service is applied to a tooth
count_service_tooth(Service, Tooth, Services, Count) :-
    findall(1, (member(service(Service, _, _, _, _, _, _, Teeth), Services), member(Tooth, Teeth)), Counts),
    length(Counts, Count).

% Helper predicate to check if a service is justified
is_justified(Service, Tooth, Services) :-
    member(service(Service, _, _, _, _, _, Justification, Teeth), Services),
    member(Tooth, Teeth),
    Justification \= ''.

is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    member(service(0090, _, _, _, _, _, _, Teeth), Services),
    member(Tooth, Teeth),
    count_service_tooth(0090, Tooth, Services, Count),
    Count > 1,
    \+ is_justified(0090, Tooth, Services),
    print('Service 0090 is applied more than once to the same tooth without justification.'),
    true.
```

Rule 2:
Thoughts: This rule states that for services 0090 and 0100, the costs of the used anesthetics can be charged separately. This means that there should be a separate material cost entry for the anesthetics used in these services. However, the rule does not specify how to identify the anesthetics in the material costs or how to link them to the services. Therefore, this rule cannot be translated into Prolog without making assumptions.

Translation:
```prolog
```

Zuschlag für die Anwendung eines
Operationsmikroskops bei den
Leistungen nach den Nummern
2195, 2330, 2340, 2360, 2410, 2440,
3020, 3030, 3040, 3045, 3060, 3110,
3120, 3190, 3200, 4090, 4100, 4130,
4133, 9100, 9110, 9120, 9130 und 9170
Der Zuschlag nach der Nummer 0110 ist je Behandlungstag nur ein -
mal und nur mit dem einfachen
Gebührensatz berechnungsfähig.
rule:
Der Zuschlag nach der Nummer 0110 ist je Behandlungstag nur ein -
mal und nur mit dem einfachen
Gebührensatz berechnungsfähig.
commentary:
GOZ Nr. 0110
Zuschlag für die Anwendung eines Operationsmi-
kroskops bei den Leistungen nach den Nummern
2195, 2330, 2340, 2360, 2410, 2440, 3020, 3030,
3040, 3045, 3060, 3110, 3120, 3190, 3200, 4090,
4100, 4130, 4133, 9100, 9110, 9120, 9130 und 9170
Abrechnungsbestimmung
Der Zuschlag nach der Nummer 0110 ist je Be-
handlungstag nur einmal und nur mit dem einfa-
chen Gebührensatz berechnungsfähig.
Punktzahl 400 Punkte
Faktor 1,0-fach
Gebühr in € 22,50 €
Kommentar zur Leistungsbeschreibung
Bei der Anwendung eines OP-Mikroskops im Zusam-
menhang mit den aufgeführten konservierenden,
endodontischen, chirurgischen, parodontalchirur-
gischen und implantologischen Leistungen kann
ein Zuschlag berechnet werden. Der Zuschlag ist je-
doch nur einmal je Behandlungstag und nur neben
einer der oben abschließend aufgeführten Leistun-
gen ansatzfähig.
Die Anwendung einer Lupenbrille oder eines Endo-
skops berechtigt nicht zum Ansatz der Nummer
0110. Die Nummer 0110 ist nur berechnungsfähig als
Zuschlag zu den in der Leistungsbeschreibung enu-
merativ abschließend benannten Gebührennum-
mern. In anderen Fällen ist die Anwendung des
Operationsmikroskops gemäß § 5 Abs. 2, bzw. § 2
Abs. 1 und 2 GOZ bei der Bemessung der Grund-
leistung berücksichtigungsfähig.
Die Leistung ist eine Zuschlagsposition und kann
daher nur mit dem einfachen Gebührensatz be-
rechnet werden, es sei denn, der Zuschlag wird
nach § 2 Abs. 1 GOZ frei vereinbart.
<<

llm_response:
Rule 1:
Thoughts: The rule states that a surcharge for the use of an operating microscope can only be applied once per treatment day and only with a simple fee rate. This means that if the service number 0110 appears more than once on the same date, the invoice is invalid. Also, if the multiplier for service number 0110 is not 1.0, the invoice is invalid. 

Translation:
```prolog
% Helper predicate to check if a service with service number 0110 is applied more than once on the same date
has_multiple_microscope_use(Services, Date) :-
    findall(Service, (member(service(0110, Date, _, _, _, _, _, _), Services)), MicroscopeServices),
    length(MicroscopeServices, Count),
    Count > 1.

% Helper predicate to check if the multiplier for service number 0110 is not 1.0
has_incorrect_multiplier(Services) :-
    member(service(0110, _, Multiplier, _, _, _, _, _), Services),
    Multiplier \= 1.0.

is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    (has_multiple_microscope_use(Services, Date) ->
        print('Invalid invoice: Surcharge for the use of an operating microscope is applied more than once on the same date.'),
        true
    ; has_incorrect_multiplier(Services) ->
        print('Invalid invoice: Surcharge for the use of an operating microscope is not applied with a simple fee rate.'),
        true
    ).
```
This code checks if the service number 0110 appears more than once on the same date or if the multiplier for this service is not 1.0. If either of these conditions is true, the invoice is marked as invalid and the reason is printed.

% Helper predicate to check if a service with service number 0110 is applied more than once on the same date
has_multiple_microscope_use(Services, Date) :-
    findall(Service, (member(service(0110, Date, _, _, _, _, _, _), Services)), MicroscopeServices),
    length(MicroscopeServices, Count),
    Count > 1.

% Helper predicate to check if the multiplier for service number 0110 is not 1.0
has_incorrect_multiplier(Services) :-
    member(service(0110, _, Multiplier, _, _, _, _, _), Services),
    Multiplier \= 1.0.

is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    (has_multiple_microscope_use(Services, Date) ->
        print('Invalid invoice: Surcharge for the use of an operating microscope is applied more than once on the same date.'),
        true
    ; has_incorrect_multiplier(Services) ->
        print('Invalid invoice: Surcharge for the use of an operating microscope is not applied with a simple fee rate.'),
        true
    ).

Bei der Anwendung eines Lasers im Zusammen-

rurgischen und implantologischen Leistungen
kann ein Zuschlag berechnet werden. Der Zu-

und nur neben einer der oben abschließend

gen wird diejenige Leistung zur Bemessung heran-

loge Bewertung angezeigt.

Rule 1:
Thoughts: 
The rule states that a surcharge for the use of a laser in the services with the numbers 2410, 3070, 3080, 3210, 3240, 4080, 4090, 4100, 4130, 4133 and 9160 is applicable. The surcharge is 100% of the simple fee of the respective service, but not more than 68 Euros. The surcharge is only billable once per treatment day. 

This rule can be translated into Prolog by checking if any of the services in the invoice have the mentioned service numbers and if so, checking if the surcharge has been correctly applied. 

Translation:
```prolog
is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    member(service(Service, Date, _, _, Charge, _, _, _), Services),
    member(Service, [2410, 3070, 3080, 3210, 3240, 4080, 4090, 4100, 4130, 4133, 9160]),
    findall(S, (member(service(S, Date, _, _, C, _, _, _), Services), S = 0120, C > 68), Surcharges),
    length(Surcharges, L),
    L > 1,
    print('Invalid invoice: Surcharge for laser use has been billed more than once on the same day or is more than 68 Euros.'),
    true.
```

Thoughts: 
The rule is identical to the first one. 

Translation:

```prolog
% The translation is identical to the first rule.
```
Rule 3:
Thoughts: 
The rule is identical to the first one. 

Translation:
```prolog
% The translation is identical to the first rule.
```

Rule 1:
Thoughts: This rule states that the service with number 1000 can be charged once a year, the service with number 1010 can be charged three times a year, and the service with number 1020 can be charged four times a year. We can translate this rule by counting the occurrences of these services in the invoice for a given year and checking if they exceed the allowed number.

Translation:
```prolog
% Helper predicate to count the occurrences of a service in a given year
service_count(Service, Year, Services, Count) :-
    findall(S, (member(service(Service, date(Year, _, _), _, _, _, _, _, _), Services)), Ss),
    length(Ss, Count).

% Rule 1
is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, invoice_date(date(Year, _, _)), _),
    (service_count(1000, Year, Services, Count), Count > 1;
     service_count(1010, Year, Services, Count), Count > 3;
     service_count(1020, Year, Services, Count), Count > 4),
    print('Invoice is invalid due to exceeding the allowed number of charges for services 1000, 1010, or 1020 in a year.'),
    true.
```

Rule 2:
Thoughts: This rule states that services with numbers 0010, 4000, and 8000, as well as consultations and examinations according to the fee schedule for doctors, can only be charged if they serve other purposes and this is justified in the invoice. However, without further information on how to determine if these services serve other purposes and how they are justified in the invoice, this rule cannot be translated into Prolog code.

```prolog
```

Rule 3:
Thoughts: This rule is identical to Rule 1 and thus the translation would be the same.

```prolog
% Rule 3

    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, invoice_date(date(Year, _, _)), _),
    (service_count(1000, Year, Services, Count), Count > 1;
     service_count(1010, Year, Services, Count), Count > 3;
     service_count(1020, Year, Services, Count), Count > 4),

    true.
```

```prolog
invoice(
    % A Service is defined trough its Service Number (Service), the date / session when it was rendered, its multiplier, the teeth it is applied to, ...
    [service(Service, date(Year, Month, Day), Multiplier, PointScore, Charge, Description, Justification, [tooth(Area, Postion), ...]), ... ],
    % Billed Material Costs are defined trough the Section of the GOZ which allows its billing, the date / session when it was rendered, its multiplier, ...
    [material_cost(GOZ_Section, date(Year, Month, Day), Multiplier, Count, Charge, Description, Justification, [tooth(Area, Postion), ...]), ... ],
    invoice_date(date(Year, Month, Day)),
    invoice_amount(InvoiceAmount)
).
% Charge = (round(PointValue in Euros * Multiplier * PointScore * 100)) / 100
% A Tooth on which a Service is applied is uniquely defined by the combination of its area and position in this area: tooth(Area, Postion) nummerated after the FDI-Zahnschema
% Area = 1 -> Right upper jaw
% Area = 2 -> Left upper jaw
% Area = 3 -> Left lower jaw
% Area = 4 -> Right lower jaw
% Position is exact position of this tooth in its area (from 1 to 8)
% Example invoice
invoice(
    [
        service(11111, date(2023, 10, 01), 1.0, 100, 5.62, 'Teeth Cleaning', '', [tooth(1,7)]),
        service(11111, date(2023, 10, 01), 1.0, 100, 5.62, 'Teeth Cleaning', '', [tooth(1,6)]),
        service(987654, date(2023, 10, 01), 3.5, 200, 39.37, 'Tooth Filling', 'Very time consuming', [tooth(1,7), tooth(1,6)]),
        service(123456, date(2023, 10, 02), 2.3, 150, 19.40, 'Consultation', '', [])
    ],
    [
        material_cost('§ 4 (1)', date(2023, 10, 02), 1.0, 1, 40.00, 'Fill Material', 'Auslagen', [tooth(1,7), tooth(1,6)])
    ]
    invoice_date(date(2023, 10, 04),
    invoice_amount(110.01)
).
```

Rule 1:
Thoughts: This rule states that the creation of an individual tray for medication application (e.g., deep-drawing tray) can be charged separately. However, the rule does not provide any specific conditions that could be checked in the invoice. Therefore, it is not possible to translate this rule into a Prolog predicate.

Translation:


Rule 2:
Thoughts: This rule states that the fee includes the cost of the medication used. However, the rule does not provide any specific conditions that could be checked in the invoice. Therefore, it is not possible to translate this rule into a Prolog predicate.

Translation:
```prolog
```

Rule 3:
Thoughts: This rule states that the use of a ready-made spoon as a medication carrier does not fulfill the content of the service under number 1030. This can be translated into a Prolog predicate by checking if the service number is 1030 and if a ready-made spoon was used. However, the information about the type of medication carrier used is not available in the given predicates. Therefore, it is not possible to translate this rule into a Prolog predicate.

```prolog
```

Rule 4:
Thoughts: This rule states that if an individually made tray for medication application is used for fluoride treatment, the service under number 1030 can be charged more than four times within a year only if it is justified in the invoice. This can be translated into a Prolog predicate by counting the number of times the service number 1030 appears in the invoice within a year and checking if a justification is provided when it appears more than four times.

Translation:
```prolog
% Helper predicate to count the number of times a service is billed within a year
count_service(Services, ServiceNumber, Year, Count) :-
    findall(Service, (member(service(ServiceNumber, date(Year, _, _), _, _, _, _, _, _), Services), Service = ServiceNumber), ServicesList),
    length(ServicesList, Count).

is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    count_service(Services, 1030, _, Count),
    Count > 4,

    true.
```

Versiegelung von kariesfreien
Zahnfissuren mit aushärtenden
Kunststoffen, auch Glattflächen -
versiegelung, je Zahn

commentary:
C Konservierende Leistungen
GOZ Nr. 2000
Versiegelung von kariesfreien Zahnfissuren mit – Facing (Versiegelung mittels Adhäsivtechnik)
aushärtenden Kunststoffen, auch Glattflächenver- nach § 6 Abs. 1 bei Schmelzerosionen oder
siegelung, je Zahn Schmelzfehlbildungen
– Facing (Versiegelung mittels Adhäsivtechnik)
Punktzahl 90 Punkte
nach § 2 Abs. 3 aus überwiegend kosmetischen
Faktor 1,0-fach 2,3-fach 3,5-fach
Gründen
Gebühr in € 5,06 € 11,64 € 17,72 € – Laserfluoreszenzanwendung zur Kariesdiagnostik
GOZ §6Abs.1
Kommentar zur Leistungsbeschreibung – u. v. m.
Die Versiegelung ist für den Bereich kariesfreier Fis-
suren oder Grübchen bei Milch- und bleibenden GOZ 1988
Zähnen berechenbar. Darüber hinaus kann die GOZ Nr.: 200
Leistung auch für die Versiegelung von Glattflä- Versiegelung von kariesfreien Zahnfissuren mit aus-
chen, z. B. Wurzeloberflächen, berechnet wer- härtenden Kunststoffen, je Zahn
den. Die relative Trockenlegung ist mit der Gebühr
Punktzahl 90 Punkte
abgegolten. Die Nummer 2000 beschreibt zwei
verschiedene, unabhängige Leistungen, die Faktor 1,0-fach 2,3-fach 3,5-fach
auch unabhängig voneinander nebeneinander Gebühr in € 5,06 € 11,64 € 17,71 €
an einem Zahn anfallen und dann auch neben-
einander berechnet werden können. Die Teilver-
siegelung einer kariesfreien Fissur, z. B. neben einer
Füllung, ist ebenfalls berechnungsfähig. Auch die
Erneuerung oder Teilerneuerung der Versiegelung
ist berechnungsfähig. Als Material müssen aushär-
tende Kunststoffe zum Einsatz kommen. Das ver-
wendete Versiegelungsmaterial ist in der Gebühr
abgegolten. Auch bei mehreren Fissuren eines
Zahnes erfolgt die Berechnung immer nur einmal
je Zahn. Eine erweiterte Fissurenversiegelung wird
wie eine definitive Füllung berechnet.
Zusätzlicher Aufwand

Grübchen an einem Zahn
– Erschwerte Trockenlegung

llm_response:
Rule 1:
Thoughts: The rule states that the service of sealing caries-free tooth fissures with hardening plastics, also smooth surface sealing, is charged per tooth. This means that if the service is applied to multiple teeth, it should be listed multiple times in the invoice, once for each tooth. We can check this by looking for services in the invoice that have more than one tooth listed in their application and have the description of the service matching the one given in the rule.

Translation:
```prolog
% Helper predicate to check if a service is applied to more than one tooth
applied_to_multiple_teeth(service(_, _, _, _, _, _, _, Teeth)) :-
    length(Teeth, Length),
    Length > 1.

% Helper predicate to check if a service matches the description given in the rule
matches_description(service(_, _, _, _, _, Description, _, _)) :-
    Description = 'Versiegelung von kariesfreien Zahnfissuren mit aushärtenden Kunststoffen, auch Glattflächen - versiegelung, je Zahn'.

is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    member(Service, Services),
    applied_to_multiple_teeth(Service),
    matches_description(Service),
    print('Invalid invoice: The service of sealing caries-free tooth fissures with hardening plastics, also smooth surface sealing, is charged per tooth. It should be listed multiple times in the invoice, once for each tooth.'),
    true.
```

oder -lacke oder Salzlösungen eingesetzt werden.

handlung überempfindlicher Zahnflächen im Sinne

Rule 1:
Thoughts: The rule states that the treatment of hypersensitive tooth surfaces should be charged per jaw. This means that if the same service is applied to multiple teeth in the same jaw, it should only be charged once. We can check this by grouping services by their service number and date, and then checking if any group contains multiple teeth from the same jaw.

Translation:
```prolog
% Helper predicate to check if a service is applied to multiple teeth in the same jaw
is_service_applied_to_same_jaw_multiple_times(Service, Services) :-
    findall(tooth(Area, _), member(service(Service, _, _, _, _, _, _, [tooth(Area, _)]), Services), Areas),
    sort(Areas, SortedAreas),
    length(SortedAreas, Length),
    Length > 1.

% Main predicate to check if the invoice is invalid
is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    member(service(Service, Date, _, _, _, _, _, _), Services),
    findall(service(Service, Date, _, _, _, _, _, _), member(service(Service, Date, _, _, _, _, _, _), Services), SameServiceAndDateServices),
    is_service_applied_to_same_jaw_multiple_times(Service, SameServiceAndDateServices),
    print('The service is applied to multiple teeth in the same jaw on the same date, but it should be charged per jaw.'),
    true.
```
This code first finds all services with the same service number and date. Then it checks if any of these services is applied to multiple teeth in the same jaw. If this is the case, it prints a message and returns true, indicating that the invoice is invalid.

llm_response:
Rule 1:
Thoughts: The rule states that the service with number 2030 can be charged at most once per session for a jaw half or a front tooth area for special measures during preparation and at most once for special measures during filling of cavities. This means that we need to check if the service 2030 is charged more than once per session for the same jaw half or front tooth area. We can do this by grouping the services by session and tooth area and then checking if the service 2030 appears more than once in any of these groups.

Translation:
```prolog
% Helper predicate to check if a service is charged more than once in a list of services
charged_more_than_once(Service, Services) :-
    findall(S, (member(S, Services), S = service(Service, _, _, _, _, _, _, _)), FoundServices),
    length(FoundServices, Count),
    Count > 1.

% Helper predicate to group services by session and tooth area
group_services_by_session_and_tooth_area(Services, GroupedServices) :-
    findall(service(Service, Date, Multiplier, PointScore, Charge, Description, Justification, Tooth), 
            (member(service(Service, Date, Multiplier, PointScore, Charge, Description, Justification, Tooth), Services), 
             Tooth = [tooth(Area, _)]), 
            GroupedServices).

is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    group_services_by_session_and_tooth_area(Services, GroupedServices),
    charged_more_than_once(2030, GroupedServices),
    print('Service 2030 is charged more than once per session for the same jaw half or front tooth area.'),
    true.
```
This code first groups the services by session and tooth area using the helper predicate group_services_by_session_and_tooth_area/2. Then it checks if the service 2030 is charged more than once in any of these groups using the helper predicate charged_more_than_once/2. If this is the case, it prints a message and returns true, indicating that the invoice is invalid.

% Helper predicate to check if a service is charged more than once in a list of services
charged_more_than_once(Service, Services) :-
    findall(S, (member(S, Services), S = service(Service, _, _, _, _, _, _, _)), FoundServices),
    length(FoundServices, Count),
    Count > 1.

% Helper predicate to group services by session and tooth area
group_services_by_session_and_tooth_area(Services, GroupedServices) :-
    findall(service(Service, Date, Multiplier, PointScore, Charge, Description, Justification, Tooth), 
            (member(service(Service, Date, Multiplier, PointScore, Charge, Description, Justification, Tooth), Services), 
             Tooth = [tooth(Area, _)]), 
            GroupedServices).

is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    group_services_by_session_and_tooth_area(Services, GroupedServices),
    charged_more_than_once(2030, GroupedServices),
    print('Service 2030 is charged more than once per session for the same jaw half or front tooth area.'),
    true.

ferhälfte oder Frontzahnbereich
reference: The text provided does not contain any references to other paragraphs.
commentary:
C Konservierende Leistungen
GOZ Nr. 2040
Anlegen von Spanngummi, je Kieferhälfte oder Zusätzlich berechnungsfähige Leistungen
Frontzahnbereich – Besondere Maßnahmen GOZ 2030
– Gingivaprotektoren zur absoluten nach Tro-
Punktzahl 65 Punkte
ckenlegung § 6 Abs. 1
Faktor 1,0-fach 2,3-fach 3,5-fach – u. v. m.
Gebühr in € 3,66 € 8,41 € 12,80 €
GOZ 1988
Kommentar zur Leistungsbeschreibung GOZ Nr.: 204
Die Leistung beschreibt die absolute Trockenle- Anlegen von Spanngummi, je Kieferhälfte oder
gung des Behandlungsgebietes mittels eines Frontzahnbereich
Spanngummis (Kofferdam). Die notwendige Aus-
Punktzahl 65 Punkte
dehnung des Spanngummis wird durch das tro-
ckenzulegende Gebiet bestimmt. Für die Faktor 1,0-fach 2,3-fach 3,5-fach
Berechnung der Gebührennummer ist nicht die Gebühr in € 3,66 € 8,40 € 12,79 €
Anzahl und/oder Lage der behandelten Zähne,
sondern die Ausdehnung des gelegten Spann-
gummis entscheidend.
Die Leistung ist je Kieferhälfte oder Frontzahnbe-
reich ggf. auch mehrmals pro Sitzung berechen-
bar, wenn die Behandlungsumstände dies
erfordern, bei erneuter absoluter Trockenlegung
z. B. nach einer Röntgenaufnahme.
Das Auftragen von Gingivaprotektoren („flüssiger
Kofferdam“) erfüllt nicht den Leistungsinhalt „An-
legen von Spanngummi“, sondern ist analog zu
berechnen.
Die Materialkosten sind nicht gesondert bere-
chenbar.
Zusätzlicher Aufwand
– Zusätzliche Benutzung von Klammern, Ligaturen,
Fäden, Interdentalkeilen
– Erschwerte Retention bei kurzer klinischer Krone
– u. v. m.
<<
Inhalt
62
Bundeszahnärztekammer|GOZ-Kommentar|Stand 25.4.2014
llm_response:
Rule 1:
Thoughts: The rule states that the application of a rubber dam (Spanngummi) is billed per jaw half or front tooth area. This means that if the same service is billed multiple times for the same jaw half or front tooth area on the same day, it is incorrect. We need to check if there are any duplicate services for the same jaw half or front tooth area on the same day.

Translation:
```prolog
% Helper predicate to check if a service is applied more than once on the same day to the same jaw half or front tooth area
applied_multiple_times(Service, Date, Area, Services) :-
    findall(S, (member(S, Services), S = service(Service, Date, _, _, _, _, _, [tooth(Area, _)])), L),
    length(L, N),
    N > 1.

% Main predicate to check the rule
is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    member(service(Service, Date, _, _, _, _, _, [tooth(Area, _)]), Services),
    applied_multiple_times(Service, Date, Area, Services),
    print('The service is applied multiple times on the same day to the same jaw half or front tooth area.'),
    true.
```
In this code, the helper predicate `applied_multiple_times/4` checks if a service is applied more than once on the same day to the same jaw half or front tooth area. It does this by finding all services in the list of services that match the given service, date, and area, and checking if the number of such services is more than one.

The main predicate `is_invoice_invalid/1` uses this helper predicate to check if any service in the invoice is applied multiple times on the same day to the same jaw half or front tooth area. If it finds such a service, it prints a message indicating the problem and returns `true`, marking the invoice as invalid.

Rule 1:
Thoughts: The rule states that the service of preparing a cavity and restoring it with plastic filling material, including underfilling, applying a matrix or using other tools to shape the filling, is a single surface procedure. This means that the service should only be applied to a single tooth. If the service is applied to more than one tooth, the invoice should be marked as invalid.

Translation:
```prolog
is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, Material_Costs, invoice_date(date(Year, Month, Day)), invoice_amount(InvoiceAmount)),
    member(service(Service, date(Year, Month, Day), Multiplier, PointScore, Charge, Description, Justification, Teeth), Services),
    Description = 'Präparieren einer Kavität und Restauration mit plastischem Füllungsmaterial einschließlich Unterfüllung, Anlegen einer Matrize oder Benutzen anderer Hilfsmittel zur Formung der Füllung, einflächig',
    length(Teeth, NumberOfTeeth),
    NumberOfTeeth > 1,
    print('Invalid invoice: The service of preparing a cavity and restoring it with plastic filling material, including underfilling, applying a matrix or using other tools to shape the filling, is a single surface procedure and should only be applied to a single tooth.'),
    true.
```
This rule checks if there is a service in the invoice with the description matching the one given in the rule. If such a service is found, it checks if the service is applied to more than one tooth. If it is, it prints a message indicating the reason for the invalidity of the invoice and returns true, marking the invoice as invalid.

Rule 1:
Thoughts: The rule describes a specific service of preparing a cavity and restoring it with composite materials, including the use of adhesive techniques, possibly including multi-layer techniques, and polishing. It also mentions the possible use of inserts. This service is not directly linked to a specific service number in the GOZ, but we can assume that it should be included in the description of the service. Therefore, we can check if such a service is billed in the invoice and if it is, whether it is applied to at least one tooth. 

Translation:
```prolog
is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    member(service(_, _, _, _, _, Description, _, Teeth), Services),
    sub_string(Description, _, _, _, "Präparieren einer Kavität und Restauration mit Kompositmaterialien"),
    Teeth = [],
    print('Invalid invoice: The service of preparing a cavity and restoring it with composite materials must be applied to at least one tooth.'),
    true.
```
In this code, we first destructure the invoice to get the list of services. Then we check if there is a service in the list that has the specific description given in the rule. If such a service exists and it is not applied to any tooth (Teeth list is empty), we print an error message and return true, indicating that the invoice is invalid.

llm_response:
Rule 1:
Thoughts: The rule states that the preparation of a cavity and restoration with plastic filling material, including underfilling, applying a matrix or using other tools to shape the filling, if more than three-sided, is a service that can be billed. This means that if a service with this description is found in the invoice, it should be checked if it is applied to more than three sides of a tooth. If it is not, the invoice is invalid. 

Translation:
```prolog
% Helper predicate to check if a service is applied to more than three sides of a tooth
is_three_sided(Service) :-
    Service = service(_, _, _, _, _, Description, _, Teeth),
    Description = 'Präparieren einer Kavität und Restauration mit plastischem Füllungsmaterial einschließlich Unterfüllung, Anlegen einer Matrize oder Benutzen anderer Hilfsmittel zur Formung der Füllung',
    length(Teeth, N),
    N > 3.

% Main predicate to check if the invoice is invalid
is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    member(Service, Services),
    is_three_sided(Service),
    print('The service of preparing a cavity and restoration with plastic filling material, including underfilling, applying a matrix or using other tools to shape the filling, is not applied to more than three sides of a tooth.'),
    true.
```
This code checks if there is a service in the invoice with the description given in the rule and if this service is applied to more than three sides of a tooth. If such a service is found and it is not applied to more than three sides of a tooth, the invoice is marked as invalid and a message is printed explaining the reason.

is_three_sided(Service) :-

llm_response:
Rule 1:
Thoughts: The rule states that the control, finishing/polishing of a restoration in a separate session, including the repolishing of an existing restoration. This implies that if a service related to polishing or finishing of a restoration is provided, it should be in a separate session. This can be translated into Prolog by checking if there is a service with a description containing 'Polishing' or 'Finishing' and if so, ensuring that there are no other services provided in the same session.

Translation:
```prolog
% Helper predicate to check if a service is a polishing or finishing service
is_polishing_finishing_service(service(_, _, _, _, _, Description, _, _)) :-
    sub_string(Description, _, _, _, 'Polishing');
    sub_string(Description, _, _, _, 'Finishing').

% Helper predicate to check if there are other services in the same session
other_services_same_session(service(_, Date, _, _, _, _, _, _), Services) :-
    member(service(_, Date, _, _, _, _, _, _), Services).

% Main predicate to check if the invoice is invalid
is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    member(Service, Services),
    is_polishing_finishing_service(Service),
    other_services_same_session(Service, Services),
    print('Polishing or Finishing service should be in a separate session'),
    true.
```
This code checks if there is a service in the invoice that is a polishing or finishing service. If such a service is found, it checks if there are other services provided in the same session. If there are, it prints a message indicating that the invoice is invalid because a polishing or finishing service should be in a separate session, and returns true to indicate that the invoice is invalid.

llm_response:
Rule 1:
Thoughts: The rule states that an "Einlagefüllung" (inlay filling) should be applied to more than two surfaces of a tooth. This means that if we find a service with the description "Einlagefüllung" in the invoice, we need to check if it is applied to more than two teeth. If it is applied to two or less teeth, the invoice is invalid. 

Translation:
```prolog
% Helper predicate to check if a service is an "Einlagefüllung" and if it is applied to more than two teeth
is_inlay_filling_applied_to_more_than_two_teeth(service(_, _, _, _, _, Description, _, Teeth)) :-
    Description = 'Einlagefüllung',
    length(Teeth, NumberOfTeeth),
    NumberOfTeeth =< 2.

% Predicate to check if an invoice is invalid based on the "Einlagefüllung" rule
is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    member(Service, Services),
    is_inlay_filling_applied_to_more_than_two_teeth(Service),
    print('Invoice is invalid: Einlagefüllung is applied to two or less teeth.'),
    true.
```
In this translation, we first define a helper predicate `is_inlay_filling_applied_to_more_than_two_teeth/1` that checks if a service is an "Einlagefüllung" and if it is applied to more than two teeth. We then use this helper predicate in the `is_invoice_invalid/1` predicate to check if any service in the invoice violates the rule. If such a service is found, we print a message indicating the reason for the invalidity of the invoice and return `true` to indicate that the invoice is invalid.

mente (ggf. nach § 2)

durch umfangreiche Hartsubstanzdefekte ge-
schädigten Zahnes mit einer plastischen Aufbau- Zusätzlich berechnungsfähige Leistungen
füllung bzw. Restauration. Sie dient der – Besondere Maßnahmen GOZ 2030

llm_response:
---
Rule 1:
Thoughts: This rule states that services 2180, 2190 or 2195 cannot be billed alongside services 2150 to 2170. This can be translated into a rule that checks if any of the services 2180, 2190 or 2195 are present in the invoice, and if so, checks that none of the services 2150 to 2170 are present.
Translation:
```prolog
is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    member(service(Service, _, _, _, _, _, _, _), Services),
    member(Service, [2180, 2190, 2195]),
    member(service(Service2, _, _, _, _, _, _, _), Services),
    between(2150, 2170, Service2),
    print('Invalid: Services 2180, 2190 or 2195 cannot be billed alongside services 2150 to 2170.'),
    true.
```
---
Rule 2:
Thoughts: This rule states that service 2180 cannot be billed alongside service 2190. This can be translated into a rule that checks if both services 2180 and 2190 are present in the invoice.
Translation:
```prolog
is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    member(service(2180, _, _, _, _, _, _, _), Services),
    member(service(2190, _, _, _, _, _, _, _), Services),
    print('Invalid: Service 2180 cannot be billed alongside service 2190.'),
    true.
```
---
Rule 3:
Thoughts: This rule states that service 2195 can be billed alongside service 2180. This rule does not impose any restrictions on the invoice, so it does not need to be translated into a rule.
Translation:
```prolog
```
---
Rule 4:
Thoughts: This rule states that services 2180, 2190 and/or 2195 can only be billed once per tooth. This can be translated into a rule that checks if any of these services are billed more than once for the same tooth.
Translation:
```prolog
is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    member(service(Service, _, _, _, _, _, _, Teeth), Services),
    member(Service, [2180, 2190, 2195]),
    findall(T, (member(service(Service, _, _, _, _, _, _, T2), Services), member(T, T2)), AllTeeth),
    sort(AllTeeth, SortedTeeth),
    length(AllTeeth, L1),
    length(SortedTeeth, L2),
    L1 \= L2,
    print('Invalid: Services 2180, 2190 and/or 2195 can only be billed once per tooth.'),
    true.
```

sind gesondert berechnungsfähig.

And this predicates:
```prolog
invoice(
    % A Service is defined trough its Service Number (Service), the date / session when it was rendered, its multiplier, the teeth it is applied to, ...
    [service(Service, date(Year, Month, Day), Multiplier, PointScore, Charge, Description, Justification, [tooth(Area, Postion), ...]), ... ],
    % Billed Material Costs are defined trough the Section of the GOZ which allows its billing, the date / session when it was rendered, its multiplier, ...
    [material_cost(GOZ_Section, date(Year, Month, Day), Multiplier, Count, Charge, Description, Justification, [tooth(Area, Postion), ...]), ... ],
    invoice_date(date(Year, Month, Day)),
    invoice_amount(InvoiceAmount)
).
% Charge = (round(PointValue in Euros * Multiplier * PointScore * 100)) / 100
% A Tooth on which a Service is applied is uniquely defined by the combination of its area and position in this area: tooth(Area, Postion) nummerated after the FDI-Zahnschema
% Area = 1 -> Right upper jaw
% Area = 2 -> Left upper jaw
% Area = 3 -> Left lower jaw
% Area = 4 -> Right lower jaw
% Position is exact position of this tooth in its area (from 1 to 8)
% Example invoice
invoice(
    [
        service(11111, date(2023, 10, 01), 1.0, 100, 5.62, 'Teeth Cleaning', '', [tooth(1,7)]),
        service(11111, date(2023, 10, 01), 1.0, 100, 5.62, 'Teeth Cleaning', '', [tooth(1,6)]),
        service(987654, date(2023, 10, 01), 3.5, 200, 39.37, 'Tooth Filling', 'Very time consuming', [tooth(1,7), tooth(1,6)]),
        service(123456, date(2023, 10, 02), 2.3, 150, 19.40, 'Consultation', '', [])
    ],
    [
        material_cost('§ 4 (1)', date(2023, 10, 02), 1.0, 1, 40.00, 'Fill Material', 'Auslagen', [tooth(1,7), tooth(1,6)])
    ]
    invoice_date(date(2023, 10, 04),
    invoice_amount(110.01)
).
```
The 4 rules indicate conditions and restrictions stated in the GOZ that should be adhered to when creating an invoice.

Keep the code as simple as possible.
To determine if an invoice is correct, use the predicate

```prolog
is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) : -
    Invoice = invoice(Services, Material_Costs, invoice_date(date(Year, Month, Day), invoice_amount(InvoiceAmount)),
    % The corresponding rule (only one rule for each predicate)

    print(...), % When rule is not fulfilled and therefore the invoice is invalid, print the reason for the invalidity of the invoice
    true. % Then the invoice is invalid.
```

is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    member(service(Service, _, _, _, _, _, _, _), Services),
    member(Service, [2180, 2190, 2195]),
    member(service(Service2, _, _, _, _, _, _, _), Services),
    between(2150, 2170, Service2),
    print('Invalid: Services 2180, 2190 or 2195 cannot be billed alongside services 2150 to 2170.'),
    true.

Die Leistung beinhaltet die Vorbereitung eines Zusätzlich berechnungsfähige Leistungen
durch umfangreiche Hartsubstanzdefekte geschä- – Plastische Aufbaufüllung GOZ 2180
digten Zahnes mit einem Schraubenaufbau oder – Adhäsive Befestigung GOZ 2197
einem Glasfaserstift oder einem ähnlichen Stiftsys- – Besondere Maßnahmen GOZ 2030
tem mit Verankerung im Wurzelkanal. Sie wird in der – Kariesdetektor § 6 Abs. 1

Es handelt sich um einen Stift, der in den Wurzel-

Zementieren ist mit der Gebühr abgegolten.

abgebildet und wird entsprechend § 6 Absatz 1
analog berechnet.

is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    member(service(Service, _, _, _, _, _, _, Teeth), Services),
    member(Service, [2180, 2190, 2195]),
    findall(T, (member(service(Service, _, _, _, _, _, _, T2), Services), member(T, T2)), AllTeeth),
    sort(AllTeeth, SortedTeeth),
    length(AllTeeth, L1),
    length(SortedTeeth, L2),
    L1 \= L2,
    print('Invalid: Services 2180, 2190 and/or 2195 can only be billed once per tooth.'),
    true.

Thoughts: 
The rule is not clear enough to be translated into a Prolog predicate. It seems to be a list of services that can be billed under the category of "Adhäsive Befestigung", but it does not provide any conditions or restrictions that can be checked against an invoice. We would need more information about what conditions these services must meet in order to be validly billed. For example, are there specific teeth that these services can be applied to? Are there limits on the number of times these services can be billed in a certain time period? Without this information, we cannot translate this rule into a Prolog predicate.

---
Adhäsive Befestigung (plastischer

krone, Veneer etc.)

And this predicates:
```prolog
invoice(
    % A Service is defined trough its Service Number (Service), the date / session when it was rendered, its multiplier, the teeth it is applied to, ...
    [service(Service, date(Year, Month, Day), Multiplier, PointScore, Charge, Description, Justification, [tooth(Area, Postion), ...]), ... ],
    % Billed Material Costs are defined trough the Section of the GOZ which allows its billing, the date / session when it was rendered, its multiplier, ...
    [material_cost(GOZ_Section, date(Year, Month, Day), Multiplier, Count, Charge, Description, Justification, [tooth(Area, Postion), ...]), ... ],
    invoice_date(date(Year, Month, Day)),
    invoice_amount(InvoiceAmount)
).
% Charge = (round(PointValue in Euros * Multiplier * PointScore * 100)) / 100
% A Tooth on which a Service is applied is uniquely defined by the combination of its area and position in this area: tooth(Area, Postion) nummerated after the FDI-Zahnschema
```

Rule 1:
Thoughts: This rule states that if a service with a number between 2200 and 2220 is billed, then services with numbers between 2050 and 2130 cannot be billed. This can be translated into a Prolog rule by checking if any service in the invoice has a number between 2200 and 2220 and if so, checking if any other service has a number between 2050 and 2130. If both conditions are met, the invoice is invalid.

Translation:
```prolog
is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    member(service(Service, _, _, _, _, _, _, _), Services),
    Service >= 2200, Service =< 2220,
    member(service(Service2, _, _, _, _, _, _, _), Services),
    Service2 >= 2050, Service2 =< 2130,
    print('Invalid invoice: If a service with a number between 2200 and 2220 is billed, then services with numbers between 2050 and 2130 cannot be billed.'),
    true.
```

And this predicates:
```prolog
invoice(
    % A Service is defined trough its Service Number (Service), the date / session when it was rendered, its multiplier, the teeth it is applied to, ...
    [service(Service, date(Year, Month, Day), Multiplier, PointScore, Charge, Description, Justification, [tooth(Area, Postion), ...]), ... ],
    % Billed Material Costs are defined trough the Section of the GOZ which allows its billing, the date / session when it was rendered, its multiplier, ...
    [material_cost(GOZ_Section, date(Year, Month, Day), Multiplier, Count, Charge, Description, Justification, [tooth(Area, Postion), ...]), ... ],
    invoice_date(date(Year, Month, Day)),
    invoice_amount(InvoiceAmount)
).
% Charge = (round(PointValue in Euros * Multiplier * PointScore * 100)) / 100
% A Tooth on which a Service is applied is uniquely defined by the combination of its area and position in this area: tooth(Area, Postion) nummerated after the FDI-Zahnschema
% Area = 1 -> Right upper jaw
% Area = 2 -> Left upper jaw
% Area = 3 -> Left lower jaw
% Area = 4 -> Right lower jaw
% Position is exact position of this tooth in its area (from 1 to 8)
% Example invoice
invoice(
    [
        service(11111, date(2023, 10, 01), 1.0, 100, 5.62, 'Teeth Cleaning', '', [tooth(1,7)]),
        service(11111, date(2023, 10, 01), 1.0, 100, 5.62, 'Teeth Cleaning', '', [tooth(1,6)]),
        service(987654, date(2023, 10, 01), 3.5, 200, 39.37, 'Tooth Filling', 'Very time consuming', [tooth(1,7), tooth(1,6)]),
        service(123456, date(2023, 10, 02), 2.3, 150, 19.40, 'Consultation', '', [])
    ],
    [
        material_cost('§ 4 (1)', date(2023, 10, 02), 1.0, 1, 40.00, 'Fill Material', 'Auslagen', [tooth(1,7), tooth(1,6)])
    ]
    invoice_date(date(2023, 10, 04),
    invoice_amount(110.01)
).
```

We want to mark invoices as invalid if they do not adhere to those rules.

parsed_code:
is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    member(service(Service, _, _, _, _, _, _, _), Services),
    Service >= 2200, Service =< 2220,
    member(service(Service2, _, _, _, _, _, _, _), Services),
    Service2 >= 2050, Service2 =< 2130,
    print('Invalid invoice: If a service with a number between 2200 and 2220 is billed, then services with numbers between 2050 and 2130 cannot be billed.'),
    true.

```prolog
    % Billed Material Costs are defined trough the Section of the GOZ which allows its billing, the date / session when it was rendered, its multiplier, ...
    [material_cost(GOZ_Section, date(Year, Month, Day), Multiplier, Count, Charge, Description, Justification, [tooth(Area, Postion), ...]), ... ],
    invoice_date(date(Year, Month, Day)),
    invoice_amount(InvoiceAmount)
).

).
```

Rule 1:
Thoughts: This rule states that if additional measures are taken, then three quarters of the respective fee can be charged. However, the rule does not specify what constitutes an "additional measure". Without this information, it is impossible to translate this rule into Prolog code.

Rule 2:
Thoughts: This rule states that the services under the numbers 2230 or 2240 can only be charged if it was objectively impossible for the dentist to continue the treatment or if a continuation was not indicated for medical reasons. This rule can be translated into Prolog code by checking if the service number is 2230 or 2240 and if the justification for the service indicates that it was impossible to continue the treatment or a continuation was not medically indicated. 

Translation:
```prolog
is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, Material_Costs, invoice_date(date(Year, Month, Day)), invoice_amount(InvoiceAmount)),
    member(service(Service, _, _, _, _, _, Justification, _), Services),
    (Service = 2230 ; Service = 2240),
    not((Justification = 'Impossible to continue treatment' ; Justification = 'Continuation not medically indicated')),
    print('Service 2230 or 2240 charged without valid justification.'),
    true.
```
In this code, the member/2 predicate is used to check if there is a service in the invoice with the number 2230 or 2240. The not/1 predicate is used to check if the justification for the service does not indicate that it was impossible to continue the treatment or a continuation was not medically indicated. If such a service is found, the print/1 predicate is used to print a message indicating that the invoice is invalid because a service 2230 or 2240 was charged without a valid justification. The true predicate is used to indicate that the invoice is invalid.

llm_response:
Rule 1:
Thoughts: The rule states that the costs for pre-fabricated crowns are separately billable. This means that if a service related to a pre-fabricated crown is present in the invoice, there should also be a corresponding material cost entry for the crown. However, the rule does not provide any specific service number or description for the pre-fabricated crown service or the corresponding material cost. Therefore, we can only check if there is a material cost entry for every service entry, but we cannot specifically check for pre-fabricated crowns.

Translation:
```prolog
% Helper predicate to check if there is a corresponding material cost for a service
has_corresponding_material_cost(Service, Material_Costs) :-
    Service = service(_, Service_Date, _, _, _, _, _, Service_Teeth),
    member(material_cost(_, Material_Date, _, _, _, _, _, Material_Teeth), Material_Costs),
    Service_Date = Material_Date,
    Service_Teeth = Material_Teeth.

% Predicate to check if the invoice is invalid due to missing material costs for a service
is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, Material_Costs, _, _),
    member(Service, Services),
    \+ has_corresponding_material_cost(Service, Material_Costs),
    print('Invoice is invalid because there is a service without a corresponding material cost.'),
    true.
```
This code checks for each service in the invoice if there is a corresponding material cost with the same date and applied to the same teeth. If there is a service without a corresponding material cost, the invoice is marked as invalid and a message is printed. However, this code does not specifically check for pre-fabricated crowns, as the rule does not provide enough information to do so.

llm_response:
Rule 1:
Thoughts: The rule states that a temporary filling in the direct procedure without taking an impression per tooth or implant, including removal, is a service that can be billed. This rule does not provide any restrictions or conditions that could invalidate an invoice. Therefore, there is no specific condition that we can check in the `is_invoice_invalid/1` predicate for this rule. However, we can create a predicate to check if such a service exists in the invoice.

Translation:
```prolog
% Helper predicate to check if a service is a temporary filling in the direct procedure without taking an impression per tooth or implant, including removal
is_temporary_filling_without_impression(Service) :-
    Service = service(_, _, _, _, _, Description, _, _),
    Description = 'Provisorium im direkten Verfahren ohne Abformung, je Zahn oder Implantat, einschließlich Entfernung'.

% Predicate to check if an invoice contains a service that is a temporary filling in the direct procedure without taking an impression per tooth or implant, including removal
contains_temporary_filling_without_impression(Services) :-
    member(Service, Services),
    is_temporary_filling_without_impression(Service).

% Predicate to check if an invoice is invalid based on the rule
is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    \+ contains_temporary_filling_without_impression(Services),
    print('Invoice does not contain a service that is a temporary filling in the direct procedure without taking an impression per tooth or implant, including removal'),
    true.
```
Please note that the `is_invoice_invalid/1` predicate will return true (i.e., the invoice is invalid) if the invoice does not contain a service that is a temporary filling in the direct procedure without taking an impression per tooth or implant, including removal. If the invoice does contain such a service, the predicate will fail (i.e., the invoice is not invalid based on this rule).

Rule 1:
Thoughts: 
The rule states that if a pre-made temporary is used, the costs for it can be billed separately. However, the reinsertion of the same temporary, possibly several times, including removal, is covered by the fee according to number 2260 or 2270. This means that if a service with number 2260 or 2270 is billed, no additional costs for the reinsertion of the same temporary should be billed. 

Translation:
```prolog
is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, Material_Costs, invoice_date(date(Year, Month, Day)), invoice_amount(InvoiceAmount)),
    member(service(2260, _, _, _, _, _, _, _), Services),
    member(material_cost(_, _, _, _, _, 'Reinsertion of the same temporary', _, _), Material_Costs),
    print('Invalid invoice: Reinsertion of the same temporary cannot be billed separately when service 2260 is billed.'),
    true.

is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, Material_Costs, invoice_date(date(Year, Month, Day)), invoice_amount(InvoiceAmount)),
    member(service(2270, _, _, _, _, _, _, _), Services),
    member(material_cost(_, _, _, _, _, 'Reinsertion of the same temporary', _, _), Material_Costs),
    print('Invalid invoice: Reinsertion of the same temporary cannot be billed separately when service 2270 is billed.'),
    true.
```

Rule 2:
Thoughts: 
The rule is identical to the first one. Therefore, the translation will be the same.

Translation:
```prolog
is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, Material_Costs, invoice_date(date(Year, Month, Day)), invoice_amount(InvoiceAmount)),
    member(service(2260, _, _, _, _, _, _, _), Services),
    member(material_cost(_, _, _, _, _, 'Reinsertion of the same temporary', _, _), Material_Costs),
    print('Invalid invoice: Reinsertion of the same temporary cannot be billed separately when service 2260 is billed.'),
    true.

    Invoice = invoice(Services, Material_Costs, invoice_date(date(Year, Month, Day)), invoice_amount(InvoiceAmount)),
    member(service(2270, _, _, _, _, _, _, _), Services),
    member(material_cost(_, _, _, _, _, 'Reinsertion of the same temporary', _, _), Material_Costs),
    print('Invalid invoice: Reinsertion of the same temporary cannot be billed separately when service 2270 is billed.'),
    true.
```

```prolog
).
```

benaufbauten oder Glasfaserstifte.

plastischem Material ist nicht Inhalt dieser Leis-

stifte im Sinne der GOZ handelt.

– Wurzelstifte in gekippten oder elongierten Zähnen

Rule 1:
Thoughts: The rule states that measures to preserve the vital pulp in case of deep caries (excavation, indirect capping) should be applied per cavity. This means that the service should be applied to each tooth individually and not to multiple teeth at once. We can check this by verifying that each service of this type is applied to exactly one tooth.

Translation:
```prolog
is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    member(service(Service, _, _, _, _, _, _, Teeth), Services),
    Service = 123456, % Assuming 123456 is the service number for "Maßnahmen zur Erhaltung der vitalen Pulpa bei Caries profunda"
    length(Teeth, TeethCount),
    TeethCount > 1,
    print('The service "Maßnahmen zur Erhaltung der vitalen Pulpa bei Caries profunda" should be applied to each tooth individually.'),
    true.
```
In this code, we first extract the list of services from the invoice. Then we check if there is a service with the number 123456 (which we assume to be the service number for "Maßnahmen zur Erhaltung der vitalen Pulpa bei Caries profunda") that is applied to more than one tooth. If such a service exists, we print a message indicating the error and return true, marking the invoice as invalid.

commentary:
GOZ Nr. 2390
Trepanation eines Zahnes, als selbständige Leistung
GOZ 1988

Die Trepanation eines bleibenden Zahnes oder Gebühr in € 3,66 € 8,40 € 12,79 €
eines Milchzahnes dient der Eröffnung des Pulpen-
kavums und der Schaffung eines Zugangs zum en-
dodontischen System oder kann zur Entlastung
infizierten Pulpengewebes und dadurch der
Schmerzstillung dienen.
Die Leistung kann an vitalen oder avitalen Zähnen
erbracht und berechnet werden. Die selbständige
Leistung "Trepanation" ist mit der Eröffnung des ko-
ronalen Pulpenkavums abgeschlossen. Weitere en-
dodontische Maßnahmen sind andere
eigenständige Leistungen. Diese sind auch berech-
nungsfähig, wenn deren Durchführung im unmittel-
baren Anschluss an die Trepanation erfolgt.
Die Wiedereröffnung eines definitiv verschlosse-
nen Zahnes zur weitergehenden Wurzelkanalbe-
handlung oder zur Revision einer vorhandenen
Wurzelkanalfüllung kann erneut nach dieser Ge-
bührennummer berechnet werden.Die Leistung ist
nicht berechenbar bei bereits freiliegendem Pul-
penkavum z. B. nach Zahnfraktur oder bei pulpen-
eröffnenden kariösen Defekten.
Zusätzlicher Aufwand
– Trepanation durch eine Krone oder ein Inlay

Zahn

Elektrometrische Längenbestim -
mung eines Wurzelkanals
Die Leistung nach der Nummer 2400 ist je Wurzelkanal höchstens
zweimal je Sitzung berechnungs-
fähig.
reference: The text does not mention any references to other paragraphs.
rule: Die Leistung nach der Nummer 2400 ist je Wurzelkanal höchstens zweimal je Sitzung berechnungsfähig.
commentary:
C Konservierende Leistungen
GOZ Nr. 2400
Elektrometrische Längenbestimmung eines Wur-
zelkanals GOZ 1988
Abrechnungsbestimmung GOZ Nr.: 240
Die Leistung nach der Nummer 2400 ist je Wur- Elektrometrische Längenbestimmung eines Wur-
zelkanal höchstens zweimal je Sitzung berech- zelkanals
nungsfähig.
Punktzahl 70 Punkte
Punktzahl 70 Punkte Faktor 1,0-fach 2,3-fach 3,5-fach
Faktor 1,0-fach 2,3-fach 3,5-fach Gebühr in € 3,94 € 9,05 € 13,77 €
Gebühr in € 3,94 € 9,05 € 13,78 €
Kommentar zur Leistungsbeschreibung
Die Feststellung der Arbeitslänge für die Aufberei-
tung des Wurzelkanals mittels elektrometrischer
Widerstandsmessung kann pro Kanal höchstens
zweimal je Sitzung berechnet werden. In Folgesit-
zungen, z. B. im Zusammenhang mit medikamen-
tösen Einlagen oder vor dem Füllen des
Wurzelkanals, ist die Nummer 2400 erneut berech-
nungsfähig.
Die elektrometrische Längenmessung kann so-
wohl im Zusammenhang mit einer maschinellen,
drehmomentkontrollierten Aufbereitung als auch
als Zwischenschritt bei der Handaufbereitung er-
folgen.
Die elektrometrische Längenmessung kann in der-
selben Sitzung auch neben Röntgenmessaufnah-
men durchgeführt werden.
Zusätzlicher Aufwand
– Verengte, verlegte oder obliterierte Wurzelka-
naleingänge
– Vorliegen von Dentikeln im endodontischen System
– mehr als zweimalige Längenmessung
– Stufenbildung im Wurzelkanal
– Erschwerte Widerstandsmessung bei Blutung
oder Exsudat im Wurzelkanal
– u. v. m.
Zusätzlich berechnungsfähige Leistungen
– Röntgen GOÄ 5000 ff.
<<
– Anlegen von Spanngummi GOZ 2040
Inhalt – u. v. m.
98
Bundeszahnärztekammer|GOZ-Kommentar|Stand 25.4.2014
llm_response:
Rule 1:
Thoughts: The rule states that the service with the number 2400 can be charged at most twice per session for each root canal. This means that we need to check for each session if there are more than two services with the number 2400 for the same tooth. We can do this by grouping the services by session and tooth and then checking the count of services with the number 2400. If the count is more than two, the invoice is invalid.

Translation:
```prolog
% Helper predicate to count the number of services with the number 2400 for a given session and tooth
count_service_2400([], _, _, Count, Count).
count_service_2400([service(2400, Date, _, _, _, _, _, [Tooth|_])|T], Date, Tooth, TempCount, Count) :-
    NewTempCount is TempCount + 1,
    count_service_2400(T, Date, Tooth, NewTempCount, Count).
count_service_2400([_|T], Date, Tooth, TempCount, Count) :-
    count_service_2400(T, Date, Tooth, TempCount, Count).

% Predicate to check if the invoice is invalid
is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    member(service(2400, Date, _, _, _, _, _, [Tooth|_]), Services),
    count_service_2400(Services, Date, Tooth, 0, Count),
    Count > 2,
    print('The service with the number 2400 is charged more than twice for the same tooth in one session.'),
    true.
```
This code first checks if there is a service with the number 2400 in the list of services. If there is, it counts the number of such services for the same session and tooth. If the count is more than two, it prints a message and returns true, indicating that the invoice is invalid.

```prolog
    % A Service is defined trough its Service Number (Service), the date / session when it was rendered, its multiplier, the teeth it is applied to, ...
    [service(Service, date(Year, Month, Day), Multiplier, PointScore, Charge, Description, Justification, [tooth(Area, Postion), ...]), ... ],
    % Billed Material Costs are defined trough the Section of the GOZ which allows its billing, the date / session when it was rendered, its multiplier, ...
    [material_cost(GOZ_Section, date(Year, Month, Day), Multiplier, Count, Charge, Description, Justification, [tooth(Area, Postion), ...]), ... ],
    invoice_date(date(Year, Month, Day)),
    invoice_amount(InvoiceAmount)
).
% Charge = (round(PointValue in Euros * Multiplier * PointScore * 100)) / 100
% A Tooth on which a Service is applied is uniquely defined by the combination of its area and position in this area: tooth(Area, Postion) nummerated after the FDI-Zahnschema
% Area = 1 -> Right upper jaw
% Area = 2 -> Left upper jaw
% Area = 3 -> Left lower jaw
% Area = 4 -> Right lower jaw
% Position is exact position of this tooth in its area (from 1 to 8)
% Example invoice
invoice(
    [
        service(11111, date(2023, 10, 01), 1.0, 100, 5.62, 'Teeth Cleaning', '', [tooth(1,7)]),
        service(11111, date(2023, 10, 01), 1.0, 100, 5.62, 'Teeth Cleaning', '', [tooth(1,6)]),
        service(987654, date(2023, 10, 01), 3.5, 200, 39.37, 'Tooth Filling', 'Very time consuming', [tooth(1,7), tooth(1,6)]),
        service(123456, date(2023, 10, 02), 2.3, 150, 19.40, 'Consultation', '', [])
    ],
    [
        material_cost('§ 4 (1)', date(2023, 10, 02), 1.0, 1, 40.00, 'Fill Material', 'Auslagen', [tooth(1,7), tooth(1,6)])
    ]
    invoice_date(date(2023, 10, 04),
    invoice_amount(110.01)
).
```

% Helper predicate to count the number of services with the number 2400 for a given session and tooth
count_service_2400([], _, _, Count, Count).
count_service_2400([service(2400, Date, _, _, _, _, _, [Tooth|_])|T], Date, Tooth, TempCount, Count) :-
    NewTempCount is TempCount + 1,
    count_service_2400(T, Date, Tooth, NewTempCount, Count).
count_service_2400([_|T], Date, Tooth, TempCount, Count) :-
    count_service_2400(T, Date, Tooth, TempCount, Count).

% Predicate to check if the invoice is invalid
is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    member(service(2400, Date, _, _, _, _, _, [Tooth|_]), Services),
    count_service_2400(Services, Date, Tooth, 0, Count),
    Count > 2,
    print('The service with the number 2400 is charged more than twice for the same tooth in one session.'),
    true.

llm_response:
Rule 1:
Thoughts: This rule states that the service with number 2410 (root canal preparation) can only be charged again for the same root canal if the root canal has been definitively treated after the first preparation. If due to anatomical peculiarities a preparation cannot be carried out in one session, the service according to number 2410 for the same root canal can be charged again. This must be justified in the invoice. For each preparation of a root canal, the service can be charged a maximum of twice in this case.

Translation:
```prolog
% Helper predicate to count the number of times a service with a specific number has been applied to a specific tooth
count_service_on_tooth(ServiceNumber, Tooth, Services, Count) :-
    findall(S, (member(service(ServiceNumber, _, _, _, _, _, _, Teeth), Services), member(Tooth, Teeth)), Ss),
    length(Ss, Count).

% Helper predicate to check if a service with a specific number has been applied to a specific tooth more than a certain number of times
service_on_tooth_exceeds_count(ServiceNumber, Tooth, Services, MaxCount) :-
    count_service_on_tooth(ServiceNumber, Tooth, Services, Count),
    Count > MaxCount.

% Main predicate to check if the invoice is invalid according to the first rule
is_invoice_invalid(Invoice) :-
    Invoice = invoice(Services, _, _, _),
    member(service(2410, _, _, _, _, _, Justification, Teeth), Services),
    member(Tooth, Teeth),
    service_on_tooth_exceeds_count(2410, Tooth, Services, 2),
    print('Service 2410 has been applied to the same tooth more than twice without sufficient justification.'),
    true.
```

Rule 2:
Thoughts: This rule is identical to the first rule. Therefore, the same Prolog code can be used.

Translation:
```prolog
% The code is identical to the first rule
```

Rule 3:
Thoughts: This rule is also identical to the first rule. Therefore, the same Prolog code can be used.

Translation:
```prolog
% The code is identical to the first rule
```

zung) mit einer Vitalexstirpation der Pulpa, in

Die Berechnung der medikamentösen Einlage ist

im Mund- und/oder Kieferbereich,
als selbstständige Leistung
reference: The text does not mention any references to other paragraphs.
commentary:
D Chirurgische Leistungen
GOZ Nr. 3050
Stillung einer übermäßigen Blutung im Mund- Zusätzlich berechnungsfähige Leistungen
und/oder Kieferbereich, als selbständige Leistung – Röntgendiagnostik GOÄ 5000 ff.
– Konsiliarische Erörterung GOÄ 60
Punktzahl 110 Punkte – Schmerzausschaltung GOZ 0090
Faktor 1,0-fach 2,3-fach 3,5-fach GOZ 0100
– Auffüllen der Alveole mit Knochenersatzmaterial
Gebühr in € 6,19 € 14,23 € 21,65 €
GOZ § 6 Abs. 1
Kommentar zur Leistungsbeschreibung – Eingliederung einer Verbandplatte
Diese Nummer ist berechnungsfähig für die Stil- GOÄ 2700
lung einer übermäßigen Blutung sowohl im Mund- – u. v. m.
als auch im Kieferbereich, intra- und/oder extrao-
ral, als selbstständige Leistung. Beim Vorliegen GOZ 1988
mehrerer, örtlich und/oder zeitlich getrennt auftre- GOZ Nr.: 305
tender Blutungen ist die Leistung mehrfach be- Stillung einer übermäßigen Blutung im Mund-
rechnungsfähig. und/oder Kieferbereich, als selbständige Leistung
Punktzahl 110 Punkte
Im Rahmen von chirurgischen Eingriffen kommt es
zwangsläufig zu Blutungen, die in der Regel von Faktor 1,0-fach 2,3-fach 3,5-fach
selbst zum Stillstand kommen oder durch einfache Gebühr in € 6,19 € 14,22 € 21,65 €
unterstützende Maßnahmen gestillt werden kön-
nen. Die Stillung einer Blutung, auch größeren Um-
fangs, die operationsspezifisch ist, ist mit der
jeweiligen Gebühr für die chirurgische Leistung
abgegolten. Nur eine Blutung, die das typische
Maß deutlich übersteigt und deren Stillung eine
Unterbrechung der eigentlichen chirurgischen
Leistung erfordert oder nach der chirurgischen
Leistung auftritt, löst den Ansatz der Nr. 3050 GOZ
aus.
Eine intraoperative, übermäßige Blutung, die z. B.
das Umstechen eines Gefäßes erfordert, wird
nach der Nummer 3060 berechnet.
Das Stillen einer Papillenblutung erfüllt den Leis-
tungsinhalt nicht.
Zusätzlicher Aufwand
– Problematische Kreislaufverhältnisse

fernekrosen (ONJ) infolge Allgemeinmedikation
z. B. Bisphosphonattherapie oder Systemerkran-
kungen
